info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 8:53PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado through 930 PM MDT... At 853 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southeast of Boyero, or 34 miles south of Flagler, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, including the following locations... Wild Horse and Aroya. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for east central Colorado.
